comments.body: Are we timing Ansible package minor release to always pick up the ansible-core minor release? As in can a user assume Ansible 4.x.0 will have ansible-core 2.11.x ? (one to one correspondence?) or is it too tricky to commit to syncing up the minor releases like this?
We haven't committed to updating the included version of ansible-core on a specific schedule, so I think we shouldn't mention anything specific here.

comments.body: Suggestion: `However, there are times when exceptions are made for critical issues.`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +173,177 @@ * At the end of the development period, the release engineers announce which Collections, and which major version of each included Collection,  will be included in the next release of the Ansible community package. New Collections and new major versions may not be added after this, and the work of creating a new release begins.

We generally do not provide fixes for unmaintained releases of the Ansible community package, however, there can sometimes be exceptions for critical issues.

Some Collections are maintained by the Ansible team, some by Partner organizations, and some by community teams. For more information on adding features or fixing bugs in Ansible-maintained Collections, see :ref:`contributing_maintained_collections`.
